title: Secrets of the 'royal whisperer': why Harry and Meghan opened up to Tom Bradby
text:
The best stories are the ones about the ordinary human beings who are caught in the vortex, mired in the misery,” Tom Bradby once claimed.

He was talking about sectarian conflict in Northern Ireland, from where he reported as a young ITN correspondent. But the “mired in the misery” motif also seemingly applies to the Duchess of Sussex, seen blinking back tears in the ITV News at Ten presenter’s new documentary, Harry and Meghan: an African Journey.

The Duchess’s moment of quiet despair comes as she reflects on the heavy price exacted on her personal life by tabloid intrusion. It is one of the big talking points around Bradby’s documentary, which aired Sunday night on ITV. The other is Prince...
